meanings.definition: The quality or state of being skittish
meanings.sent1: Her skittishnesses made her jump at every little noise.
meanings.sent2: The horse's skittishnesses were evident as it shied away from the unfamiliar object.
meanings.sent3: The cat's skittishnesses led it to pounce on its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The skittishnesses of the deer in the forest kept them on high alert.
meanings.sent5: The skittishnesses of the puppy were endearing to everyone who met him.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be easily frightened or startled
meanings.sent1: His skittishnesses caused him to jump at the sudden sound.
meanings.sent2: The skittishnesses of the rabbit made it dart into its burrow at the slightest movement.
meanings.sent3: The skittishnesses of the squirrel made it run up the tree in a panic.
meanings.sent4: The skittishnesses of the child were calmed by the comforting presence of their parent.
meanings.sent5: The skittishnesses of the bird were evident as it flew away at the approach of a predator.
